title.value: Iterated Denoising Energy Matching for Sampling from Boltzmann Densities
title.justification: The title is clearly stated at the beginning of the document and at the header of each page.
title.quote: Iterated Denoising Energy Matching for Sampling from Boltzmann Densities

extractions.description: This paper introduces Iterated Denoising Energy Matching (iDEM), an algorithm designed to sample from Boltzmann distributions using a novel method that trains a diffusion-based sampler. It achieves this without the need for data samples, relying instead on the energy function and its gradient. iDEM is tested on various tasks, showcasing its ability to outperform existing methods in terms of sampling efficiency and quality.

type.justification: The paper presents an empirical evaluation of the proposed iDEM method through experiments comparing it with existing approaches on different datasets.
type.quote: We evaluate iDEM on a suite of tasks ranging from standard synthetic energy functions to invariant n-body particle systems.

name.justification: The paper contributes to the field of deep learning by proposing a new algorithm for sampling in deep generative models.
name.quote: Unlike the typical machine learning settings where the starting point is a dataset, learning to sample in many of these scientific settings is especially challenging.

name.justification: The paper focuses on developing a generative sampling algorithm, specifically diffusion-based samplers for Boltzmann distributions.
name.quote: This work studies amortized sampling from Boltzmann densities, a problem of general interest in machine learning.

name.justification: The paper deals with sampling from probability densities, a core task in probabilistic inference.
name.quote: A fundamental task in probabilistic inference is drawing samples from an unnormalized probability density.

name.justification: The paper presents iDEM as the main contribution, which is a novel diffusion-based sampling model.
name.quote: In this paper, we propose ITERATED DENOISING ENERGY MATCHING (iDEM), a neural sampler based on denoising diffusion models for sampling from a Boltzmann distribution.

is_contributed.justification: iDEM is the primary contribution of this paper, as emphasized in its title and throughout the text.
is_contributed.quote: our proposed iDEM algorithm uses a novel stochastic matching loss in the inner loop to train a diffusion sampler.

is_executed.justification: The paper provides results from multiple experiments demonstrating the implementation and validation of iDEM.
is_executed.quote: We evaluate iDEM on a suite of tasks ranging from standard synthetic energy functions to invariant n-body particle systems.

is_compared.justification: iDEM's performance is compared against other baseline models in the experiments section.
is_compared.quote: We compare iDEM to three recent works: the path integral sampler (PIS), denoising diffusion sampler (DDS), and flow annealed bootstrapping (FAB).
